image.altText: Brittany Higgins arrives at court.

props.synopsis: After more than four days in the witness box, Brittany Higgins concludes her evidence to the Federal Court, in a defamation trial brought by Bruce Lehrmann against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Brittany Higgins's cross-examination in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial wraps up. Here's what happened

image.altText: Forecast maximum temperatures at 4pm on Friday.

props.synopsis: Temperatures are expected to exceed 45C in some locations, marking the first big heatwave of the summer.

title.children: Half of Australia is covered by heatwave warnings this week — and that's before the rain and cyclone

image.altText: Map showing Cyclone Jasper near the coast of Far North Queensland

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Jasper is currently near the Solomon Islands and could escalate to a category three system later this evening, according to the Bureau of Meteorology.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Jasper expected to intensify to category three today as it tracks towards Queensland coast

image.altText: A high-tech octagonal telescope.

props.synopsis: A newly installed telescope just outside Canberra is promising big benefits for those exploring outer space, offering high-speed communications from satellites with low-Earth orbit to the Moon and beyond.

title.children: A 'world-first' telescope allowing Australia to play a starring role in space communications

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

props.synopsis: The exclusivity agreement and an invoice have been released by the Federal Court as part of Mr Lehrmann's defamation trial against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Seven Network paying Bruce Lehrmann's rent at cost of $4,000 per fortnight, court documents reveal

image.altText: A black and white image of a man squatting down in a field.

props.synopsis: Anthony Kenyon has pleaded guilty to pushing the 12-year-old off her bike, dragging her through a park and strangling her as she was riding home from school in 2022.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for knocking girl off bike and strangling her unconscious

image.altText: A mum and dad hold their baby and smile for the camera at a first birthday

props.synopsis: Max put his dreams of paying for gender-affirming top surgery on hold when he became a father, but an application by the Australian Society of Plastic Surgeons to add it to the Medicare Benefits Schedule could change that.

title.children: New father among an estimated 125,000 to benefit if gender-affirming surgery is added to Medicare

image.altText: Daniel Andrews makes a hand gesture at a press conference. He is outdoors

props.synopsis: The impartiality of Victoria's public service has been "eroded" by a culture of fear and secrecy and an over-reliance on consultants by the Andrews Labor government, a damning ombudsman investigation finds.

title.children: Public service impartiality 'eroded' in Victoria by a 'culture of fear', ombudsman says

image.altText: Anita Patel stands waiting in a bus stop, with a large bus behind her.

props.synopsis: More than a third of Melburnians have never caught a local bus, according to the state's peak infrastructure body, which has recommended an overhaul of the city's network.

title.children: Anita catches three buses over 90 minutes to get to work. She only travels a few suburbs

image.altText: Inside a tunnel

props.synopsis: The hotly anticipated but unfinished document was mistakenly posted on the Department of Planning website on Tuesday, but deleted shortly after. It also appears to reveal the fate of the Metro West project.

title.children: Sydney suburbs targeted for high-density housing revealed in accidentally published list

image.altText: Man holding up middle finger.

props.synopsis: A jury has found Canberra man Jason Paul Hawkins guilty of murdering Newcastle woman Stacey Klimovitch when she answered her front door.

title.children: Convicted hitman guilty of murdering Newcastle grandmother

image.altText: Two children snorkling.

props.synopsis: Queensland's workplace safety regulator has urged the increased vigilance of dive operators after the deaths of two tourists in their 70s on snorkelling trips in a matter of weeks.

title.children: Second tourist in their 70s dies snorkelling on Great Barrier Reef within three weeks

image.altText: Teacher Roger Amy talking to the class.

props.synopsis: Students throughout the world have fallen behind on reading and maths during the pandemic, but Australian teens have managed to buck the trend.

title.children: New data shows many Australian teens are falling behind at school. This teacher is not surprised

image.altText: A truck with a load of gas in front of a helium plant

props.synopsis: Australia will now import all its helium after the only production plant in the southern hemisphere shuts down.

title.children: Australia's only helium plant shuts down after gas supply for Darwin plant runs out

image.altText: A group of animated astronauts stand to attention underneath a giant starship

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest and most celebrated game developers announces sweeping cuts and pauses development on high profile new title. It comes off the back of a tough year for the global gaming industry.

title.children: 'My stomach just fell to the floor': The call that crushed an Australian video game studio

image.altText: A close up of a young girl with a scar on her face lying in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Inside Gaza's overwhelmed hospital system, an influx of injured children arriving alone without any family has prompted doctors to coin a new term: Wounded Child, No Surviving Family.

title.children: Inside Gaza's overwhelmed hospital system, doctors have coined a new term for wounded children arriving alone

image.altText: A teenage boy carrying a backpack pushes a cabinet on wheels as a younger boy walks next to him, rubble in background

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accuses international human rights groups of turning a blind eye to rapes that Israel says were committed by Hamas militants during their October 7 cross-border rampage. Follow live.

title.children: US announces visa restrictions for violent Israeli settlers, in rare move against Israel

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Netanyahu accuses the international community of playing down Hamas attacks
Relatives of remaining hostages label meeting with Israeli PM a 'disgrace'

image.altText: A man wearing a brown bula shirt speaks into a microphone sitting at a table with another person

props.synopsis: In a fiery speech in Canberra, Fiji's deputy prime minister warns the Pacific could face instability if it doesn't reach development goals and is once again pressing Australia to agree to a European-style zone of free movement in the region.

title.children: Fiji's deputy prime minister pushes for visa-free travel across the Pacific

image.altText: A cow in a feedlot, eating.

props.synopsis: There's been a flurry of announcements and initiatives aimed at trying to dramatically reduce the amount of methane escaping into the atmosphere each year.

title.children: These Australian companies are highlighting ways to reduce methane emissions at COP28

image.altText: Peta Murphy playing with Alicia Paynes baby.

props.synopsis: Peta Murphy is remembered as a happy warrior who used her role in public life to fight for the rights of others.

title.children: 'This is truly a loss for our nation': Parliament pays tribute to Labor MP Peta Murphy

image.altText: Anthony albanese wears a grey suit and leans on a table in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Imminent reform to rein in the cost of the National Disability Insurance Scheme and mounting calls for the GST "no-worse-off guarantee" to be made permanent will dominate today's national cabinet meeting in Canberra.

title.children: NDIS reform and GST arrangements on national cabinet agenda

image.altText: A man on a motorbike inserts a letter marked "express" into a mail slot.

props.synopsis: Australia Post will only be required to deliver letters every second day, enabling the corporation to deliver more parcels and stem its financial losses.

title.children: Letter delivery to be reduced to every second day as Australia Post seeks to expand parcel business

image.altText: Sliding glass doors into a building with the words Reserve Bank of Australia written above.

props.synopsis: The mathematics of falling inflation suggest further rate rises are unlikely but if inflation accelerates over the holiday season, the Reserve Bank probably will reconsider, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: Homeowners get a Christmas interest rate reprieve, but the next two months will be crucial

image.altText: A homeless person sleeping on bench in the Brisbane CBD

props.synopsis: A growing number of churches are teaming up in their local areas to provide beds for the homeless in winter, with a group of ministers in north-west Tasmania hoping to create a blueprint for others.

title.children: A group of ministers want to open their churches at night — but they are not 'pushing' religion, just a place to stay

image.altText: Perth Karate instructor Gavin Smith enters Perth District Court.

props.synopsis: A Perth karate instructor who denied ever having any inappropriate contact with a teenage student is found guilty of sexually abusing the girl, starting when she was aged 15 and he offered to mentor her.

title.children: Senior Perth karate sensei found guilty of sexually abusing teenage student

image.altText: Front of Toowoomba Hospital on Queensland's Darling Downs on December 18, 2021.

props.synopsis: A 26-year-old woman, who was assaulted while undergoing surgery to her left arm, is seeking $500,000 in damages.

title.children: Woman sues health service after being sexually assaulted while unconscious during surgery

image.altText: Sergeant Matthew Hartfield stands on red dirt next to around 30 cartons of alcohol as a bulldozer lines up to destroy it.

props.synopsis: WA Police and some regional shires say 25 towns should be subject to similar liquor restrictions as Carnarvon due to levels of alcohol fuelled violence up to 104 times higher than the metropolitan area.

title.children: 'Now not the time' for blanket bans, liquor stores' peak body says, as police and some shires push for restrictions

image.altText: A middle-aged woman with blonde hair wearing all black clothing and sitting on a black motorcycle in the countryside.

props.synopsis: Female motorcyclists are outnumbered by their male counterparts in New South Wales, but the gap is becoming smaller each year, which some have credited to riding groups and social media.

title.children: Janine still gets surprised looks while on her motorcycle, but that's starting to change

image.altText: People walk down a Sydney street.

props.synopsis: Australia's economy grew by 0.2 per cent in the September quarter — lower than expectations — but rose by 2.1 per cent in the past year, new figures reveal. Meanwhile, the local share market is higher in response to the GDP figures, despite a mixed session on Wall Street. Follow live.

title.children: Australia's GDP figures miss forecasts, union says Australia Post changes will project jobs, local shares higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Aussie dollar edges up as markets bet on interest rate cuts in 2024
Chance of another rate hike has disappeared
Australia's economy starting to feel the toll

image.altText: A Canadian player contests for the ball alongside a Matildas opponent in an international women's friendly.

props.synopsis: Coming off a 5-0 thrashing, the Matildas are prepared to risk conceding goals in the second friendly with Canada, if it means nailing down their focus on building up in possession.

title.children: Matildas to change line-up, not style against Canada

image.altText: A couple sitting on the ground with the husband looking at camera.

props.synopsis: Khairul's family is among more than 1,000 Rohingya refugees who recently fled from a refugee camp in Bangladesh to another uncertain future in Indonesia.

title.children: 'The future looked dark': Why record numbers of refugees are making a 'terrifying' boat trip to Indonesia

image.altText: An aerial photo of a series of ships lashed side to side in a line.

props.synopsis: The Philippine Coast Guard revealed it was monitoring more than 135 Chinese vessels "swarming" at a disputed South China Sea reef within the country's exclusive economic zone.

title.children: Here's why Chinese vessels were 'swarming' at a South China Sea reef, and what the Philippines is doing about it

image.altText: The female British pop group, " Spice Girls" perform at a sold-out Madison Square Garden.

props.synopsis: The Sun and defunct News of the World publisher News Group Newspapers had given public apologies and paid out "substantial damages" to the claimants, according to their lawyers.

title.children: Spice Girl, boy band star and former UK MP settle decades-old phone hacking claims
